game:ps-quickstart-text:
Primitive Survival: Quick Start Guide
Step one: Survive. Step two: Thrive!

Updated versions of this mod and additional documentation can be found here.

Introduction
This mod is intended to be a somewhat realistic alternative to activities such as hunting and animal husbandry, although it will complement those approaches quite nicely.

To be a successful primitve survivalist, you'll have to leverage a variety of the tactics described below in order to acquire much sought after high calorie proteins (along with the other necessities that mammals provide).

Location, Location, Location
It's important to choose an appropriate location to call home, ideally near a decent size water source that has plenty of reeds around. If possible, collect some food, sticks and hard stones along the way.

Essentials
Although sticks, stones, and food are enough to get your trapline started, you are probably going to want a few other core ingredients in order to take a multi-pronged primitive survival approach. Consider knapping a knife to make some stakes (and to harvest cattails from reeds). Use the cattails to make some cordage.

Trapping
Build some deadfalls and/or snares and set them up at various locations nearby. These traps are much more effective when baited, which can be done by clicking on them with some sort of food in your active inventory slot. If a trap has been tripped, right click to set it again, and re-bait it as required.

Snares require a bit more time and effort to assemble, but are capable of catching larger mammals than a deadfall.

You can also trap and kill mammals by sharpening a handful of sticks to make a bundle of wood spikes, then push them into soft ground (ideally in a pit). Use these same wood spikes to build a camouflage cover for your pit trap. Once completed, nearby mammals will come and investigate (and hopefully fall into your trap).

After you've mastered clay forming and smelting, you can make a mold for a bed-o-nails which does even more damage than wood spikes and can be placed on any suface.

Fishing
Use sticks and cordage to build fish baskets and place them in the water to start fishing. You will attract more fish if you bait your fish basket (just like baiting a trap).

Alternatively, simply use stakes and make a weir trap. To do so, use stakes to build a fenced in area in the water or at the edge of the water with an open block of water in the middle of it, then right click on the far side of that fenced in area (the stake). The stakes will form an M shape, meaning that the weir trap is active.

You may have better luck fishing if you set up a limb line or trotline (using cordage, and perhaps stakes). Choose any suitable block (like a tree, block of dirt, or place a stake in the ground next to a water source). For a trotline, place another suitable block directly across the water from it. Then, with cordage in your active inventory slot, target one stake/block while facing the water and click to attach your cordage.

Next, you'll need to knap some fishing hooks to attach to your line, or carve one out of bone. With hooks in your active inventory slot, click on the line above the water to attach them. Finally, consider baiting the hooks (just like traps) to make them more effective.

A limb line or trotline may prove to be more effective for catching fish and it doesn't have the same space restrictions as a fishing basket (so you won't need much water). Once you've mastered clayforming and smelting you can make molds for metal fishing hooks and fishing lures. Attach a lure to your hook to improve your odds of catching fish.

Foodstuffs

Cook your fish on a fire to get some much needed protein. You can also add fish to soup and stew recipes in place of meat. Fillet your fish for easier cooking and storage.

If you search around or look under branches and stones, you might be able to capture (right click) some earthworms and then use them for a variety of things. Eat them for a quick protein boost, bait your hooks or fish baskets with them, place (sneak right-click) them on fertile soil to aerate and fertilize your garden, or place them in a hole of fertile soil to create worm castings which can then be used as fertilizer.

If you've got some red meat or bushmeat, cut it up to make to make raw redmeat jerky or raw bushmeat jerky. You'll still have to wait for it to cure before you can eat it (or you can cook it if you're growing impatient).

Other

With a pelt in hand, click on the ground to place it down and liven up your humble abode.

If you've successfully placed a trotline, you know enough to build yourself a monkey bridge to get across large ravines or lakes with ease. The only real difference is that the two end points need to be large blocks (stacked two high) or trees.

You can also smith a metal handle, and along with metal plates make yourself a metal bucket. This bucket can be used for many of the same things as a wooden bucket, but can also be used to move lava.

Sea shells and other suprises (the things that shall not be named) may occasionally find their way into your fish baskets and weir traps.

There's a lot more to explore beyond what's mentioned above, most notably a unique raft variant, tree hollows, irrigation methods, a meat smoker, spear fishing, fireworks, fuses, explosives...and the list goes on. Click this link to see a more comprehensive list.
itemdesc-cordage: A key ingredient for trapping and fishing.
blockdesc-limbtrotlinelure-*: If it's above water, and has a baited hook, you're going to catch something.
blockdesc-limbtrotlinelure-catch-rotten: Unfortunately, it smells a little funky.
blockdesc-limbtrotlinelure-hook-needed: Put a hook on that line if you expect to catch something.
blockdesc-stake-*: A sharpened stick which can be securely pushed into dirt or gravel. A useful ingredient for trapping and fishing. Also makes a good fence.
blockdesc-stakeinwater-*: A sharpened stick which can be securely pushed into dirt or gravel. A useful ingredient for trapping and fishing. Also makes a good fence.
itemdesc-fishinghook-*: Attach this to a limb line or your trotline.
blockdesc-fishbasket*: Place this in the water (with open water all around it) to catch something.
blockdesc-fishbasket-catch-rotten: It smells a little funky in there.
blockdesc-weirtrap-*: This weir trap is functional and could potentially catch you some fish.
blockdesc-deadfall-bait-rotten: Your bait has gone rotten. Replace it with fresh bait.
blockdesc-deadfall-bait-ok: It's baited so your odds of catching something are pretty good.
blockdesc-deadfall-bait-needed: Bait it with some food to increase your odds of catching something.
itemdesc-psfish-*-raw: A delicious source of protein once cooked.
itemdesc-fishfillet-raw: A delicious source of protein once cooked.
itemdesc-jerky-*-raw: This meat will cure on its own, or you can cook it if you're getting anxious.
blockdesc-temporalbase-incomplete: It looks like something is missing.
itemdesc-psgear-astral: Could this unlock the mysteries of the cosmos?
itemdesc-psgear-ethereal: Weighty like stone, but it's appearance lacks substance.
blockcraftdesc-pslargemold-raw-fishinglu: To cast metal lures to attach to Fishing Hooks
blockcraftdesc-pslargemold-raw-metalfish: To cast metal hooks to attach to limb lines and trotlines
blockcraftdesc-pslargemold-raw-spikeplat: A spike covered plate for a pit trap
itemdesc-fishinglure-*: Add this to your hook to increase your chances of catching something.
itemdesc-metalfishinghook-*: Attach this to a limb line or your trotline.
blockdesc-spikeplate-*: Severely damages entities that walk or fall on it.
blockdesc-woodspikes: Damages entities that walk or fall on them.
blockdesc-woodsupportspikes: Cover with plants and/or dry grass.
itemdesc-woodspikebundle-*: Damages entities that walk or fall onto them.
blockdesc-snare-suitable-ground-needed: you need more suitable ground to place this trap
blockdesc-firework-suitable-ground-neede: you need more suitable ground to place this stake
blockdesc-alcove-unlit: Right click with a torch or a candle to light the candle.
blockdesc-alcove-lit: Right click with nothing in your hand to extinguish the candle.
blockdesc-deadfall-tripped: It's tripped. Right click to set it back up.
blockdesc-temporalbase-book-dagon-hint: The book tells of the Mother Hydra and the Father Dagon.  They're awakened by some sort of cosmic energy and rejuvenated by water. Only then can you feed them and be requited.
blockdesc-temporalbase-book-cthulhu-hint: The book tells of the Great Cthulhu.  It's awakened by some sort of transitory energy and feeds off the earth itself.  Once those needs are met you can feed it and be requited.
blockdesc-temporalbase-book-nephrenka-hi: The book tells of distant worlds.  The specifics are beyond your comprehension.
blockdesc-temporalbase-gateway-open: You've opened a gateway the size of a
blockdesc-temporalbase-gateway-open-succ: and have unleashed some sort of cosmic horror!
blockdesc-temporalbase-area-needed: It appears to be complete and you can feel a strange energy in the air, but the surrounding conditions aren't quite right.
blockdesc-woodsuppportspikes-concealment: dry grass or some other plant based material to conceal your pit
Add dirt or sand to camouflage your pit
itemdesc-fisheggs-raw-ovulated: Can be cooked, cured, or thrown into water to replenish fish stocks
itemdesc-snakemeat-raw: A delicious source of protein once cooked.
itemdesc-crabmeat-raw: A delicious source of protein once cooked.
blockdesc-fireflies-empty*: Bait with fruit to attract fireflies.
blockdesc-fireflies-baited*: Place near lots of flowers on a warm night to catch fireflies.
blockdesc-woodjarholder-north: Ideal for attaching jars of fireflies to a wall
itemdesc-linktool: Used to link block locations to a Particulator
generates-atlinkedpos: Generates particles at the linked location.
place-beside: Place next to one that's configured as Primary.
particulator-guide:
Particulator

All you need to get started is a Particulator - a block with a gui that you can use to design particle effects.

To get an understanding of how the various settings of a particulator actually work, you might want to start by selecting the Stationary Cube predefined particle, and then make small incremental changes to it.

You can use the various predefined particles as is, or find one that is similar to what you're trying to create and then modify it to your liking.


Particulator Link Tool

The Particulator Link Tool makes it easy to relocate or combine particle effects. First select the block that you want to move the particle to, then select the particulator that has the effect. Move the particle effect back to the particulator by using the link tool twice on the particulator itself.

An easy way to combine particle effects is by linking multiple particulators to the exact same block. If you can't link to a block (like air or water), first place a block that IS linkable (almost anything), link to it, and finally remove/replace that block.


Gui Controls

Some of the settings are very sensitive. Simply hover over them and then use the Mouse Wheel to increment/decrement by one.

Hold down Left-Shift and use the mouse wheel for more granular changes (0.1), or Left-Ctrl mouse wheel for highly granular changes (0.01).

There's no need to click at all if the gui is selected.


Moving/Duplicating Particulators

You can break and then move particulators as required, both in survival and creative modes. When you move a particulator all of its custom settings are retained, except for its linked location and the Use Colors from Linked Block setting. This is by design. Make multiple copies of your customized particulator by placing and then breaking it while in creative mode.


Particle Types

Most of your particle effects will probably be Primary. You can create more advanced particle types by placing one or two more particulators next to your primary particulator and assigning them the type Secondary or Death. Check out the Fireworks related predefined particles to see secondary and death particles in action.

A Secondary particle effect is emitted while the primary particles are in flight.

A Death particle effect is generated when the primary particles die.

Important: Try using opposite model types when combining a primary and a secondary/death particle effect, otherwise you'll often see odd residual effects (flickering particles in strange places). For example, if your primary particle is a cube, make your secondary/death particle a quad (and vice-versa).

Important: Be extremely conservative with your quantity/life length when combining particle effects, otherwise you'll reach your particle limits and wonder why your particulators aren't spawning particles correctly.

Also worth noting, two or more primary particulators can share a single secondary or death particulator, but a primary particulator can only leverage one secondary and one death particulator.


Particle Optimization

By default, particulators spawn particles off thread (Async) - this is more performant, customizable, and allows for more particles to be generated at once. Select Run in Main Thread to disable this option.

From a modding perspective it is easier to simply generate particles in the main thread, and this is likely the preferred method if your effect is "one and done".

The game's clientsettings.json can be adjusted in order to allow for more (or less) particles to be generated simultaneously:

"maxQuadParticles": 8000
"maxCubeParticles": 4000
"maxAsyncQuadParticles": 80000
"maxAsyncCubeParticles": 80000

Alternatively, these settings can be adjusted in game via:

.clientconfig maxQuadParticles #
.clientconfig maxCubeParticles #
.clientconfig maxAsyncQuadParticles #
.clientconfig maxAsyncCubeParticles #


Supporting Info

The Vintage Story wiki has some valuable supporting documentation:

Modding: Simple Particles.
Natfloat: Distribution Modes.

For modders, searching the Anego Studio Repositories on Github for terms like particle can provide even more insight into Vintage Story particle generation. Also take a closer look at C# classes/interfaces such as:

SimpleParticleProperties
AdvancedParticleProperties
asyncParticleSpawn
IAsyncParticleManager


Share Your Creations

If you create something amazing, please share the particulate code with me and I will incorporate it directly into the next mod release! To do so, choose Code - Particulate - Copy Code, and paste it into Discord chat (PM SpearAndFang#6757).
blockdesc-earthwormcastings: Break this block and use the drops to fertilize your farmland.
blockdesc-better*: Put regular stairs back in the crafting grid to convert them to or from more dynamic stairs.
blockdesc-raft*: Hold it in your active inventory slot and simply walk in and out of water to use it. No buttons required.
blockdesc-necronomicon-*: What is this mysterious book?  Surely there's a way to open it...
blockdesc-snare-set*: Place it in soft ground to catch animals.  Bait it so it's more effective.
blockdesc-woodlantern*: Not as bright as a regular lantern, but no glass required and it looks pretty.
blockdesc-firework-*: Place it in soft ground and light it with a torch.  Enjoy the show!
blockdesc-cthulu-statue*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to mount on top of something...
blockdesc-dagon-statue*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to mount on top of something...
blockdesc-hydra-statue*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to mount on top of something...
blockdesc-temporalbase*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to be some sort of receptacle...
blockdesc-temporalcube*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to be some sort of receptacle...
blockdesc-temporallectern*: What is this strange artifact and why does it have a hole in the bottom?
blockdesc-deadfall*: Place it on the ground to catch animals.  Bait it so it's more effective
blockdesc-particulator-*: Particle effects generator for all occasions. Use a link tool to extend its functionality.
blockdesc-foxhead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-foxhide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-harehead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-harehide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-hyenahead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-hyenahide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-pighead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-pighide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-raccoonhead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-raccoonhide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-sheephead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-sheephide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
blockdesc-wolfhead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-wolfhide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
itemdesc-buckethandle-*: You'll need one of these to make a metal bucket.
itemdesc-earthworm: Eat it, use it for bait, place it on farmland, or use it in a controlled environment to manufacture worm castings.
itemdesc-monkeybridge: Connects between two two high block pillars or trees to span large distances.
itemdesc-snake-*: Good eating if it's docile or doesn't kill you first.
itemdesc-woodspikebundle: Place in soft ground vertically for a pit trap, or horizontally to conceal a pit trap.
blockdesc-bearhead*: Place your pelts on the wall to liven up a room.
blockdesc-bearhide*: Place your pelts on the floor to liven up a room.
itemcraftdesc-buckethandle-*: used for crafting a metal bucket
blockdesc-nephrenka-statue*: What is this strange artifact?  It appears to mount on top of something...
blockdesc-skullofthedead**: Place in soft ground to slowly drain the life from nearby creatures
blockdesc-handofthedead-empty*: Add a candle to make an extraordinary light source
blockdesc-metalbucket-empty-*: A bucket that's sturdy enough to transport lava
blockdesc-temporalbase-gateway-open-fail: and if it was bigger you might unleash some sort of cosmic horror!
itemdesc-fuse-*: Place on the ground next to incendiary devices to connect them.
blockdesc-bfuse-*: For connecting incendiary devices together.  Light it with a torch.
itemdesc-grunter: Place in your offhand. Use with a stick for grunting earthworms.
blockdesc-irrigationvessel-*: Use instead of water blocks for better farmland irrigation.
fill-irrigationvessel: Fill with water to keep all neighboring farmland moist.
working-irrigationvessel: This irrigation vessel is fully functional.
wrongliquid-irrigationvessel: Farmland can only be kept moist with water.
bury-irrigationvessel: Click on this irrigation vessel with a block of dirt to bury it.
blockdesc-smoker-*: Add 4 firewood and up to 4 raw trussed meats, then light with a torch to start the process.
itemhelp-trussedmeat-*: Used or created with the smoker
item-blockage: Debris is causing a problem with irrigation.
achievement-psdontpokethebear-desc: Craft wood spikes or a bed-o-nails.
achievement-pslivenupthejoint-desc: Break a placed pelt or mounted fish.
achievement-psupinsmoke-desc: Truss and then smoke some meat.
achievement-pstheresasnakeinmyboot: There's a Snake in my Boot
achievement-pssuperpooper-desc: Break a block of worm castings.
achievement-psbugcatcher-desc: Catch some fireflies in a jar.
achievement-psreanimator-desc: Acquire a skull or hand of the dead.
AltarDropsFish-Comment:
Whether or not the functioning
altars will drop fish along with
everything else.
AltarDropsGold-Comment:
Whether or not the functioning
altars will drop gold along with
everything else.
AltarDropsVegetables-Comment:
Whether or not the functioning
altars will drop vegetables along
with everything else.
DeadfallBaitStolenPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that a deadfall
will have its bait stolen and
inflict no damage.
DeadfallMaxAnimalHeight-Comment:
Entities with this eye height or
less can be seriously damaged by
this trap (so, foxes or smaller).
DeadfallMaxDamageSet-Comment:
Maximum damage inflicted by an
unbaited (set) deadfall.
DeadfallMaxDamageBaited-Comment:
Maximum damage inflicted by a
baited deadfall.
DeadfallTrippedPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that a deadfall
will be tripped and inflict no
damage
FallDamageMultiplierWoodSpikes-Comment:
A damage multiplier applied to
wooden spikes - fall velocity also a
factor.
FallDamageMultiplierMetalSpikes-Comment:
A damage multiplier applied to
the bed o' nails - fall velocity also a
factor.
FishBasketCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish in an unbaited fish basket,
every Fish Basket Update Minutes.
FishBasketBaitedCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish in an baited fish basket, every
Fish Basket Update Minutes.
FishBasketBaitStolenPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that the bait
will be stolen from a fish basket,
every Fish Basket Update Minutes.
FishBasketEscapePercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that a fish will
escape from a fish basket, every
Fish Basket Update Minutes.
FishBasketUpdateMinutes-Comment:
Real life minutes until fish
baskets are potentially updated.
FishBasketRotRemovedPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that rot will be
removed from a fish basket, every
Fish Basket Update Minutes.
FishChanceOfEggsPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of getting fish
eggs as well when you fillet a fish.
50% of the time those will be
regular eggs, 50% of the time they
will be ovulated eggs.
FishChunkDepletionRate-Comment:
Every time a fish is caught, you
are this % less likely to catch
another fish. Likewise, if a fish
escapes or is released into a chunk,
the chunk is repleted of fish by
this same %.
FishChunkRepletionRate-Comment:
Percentage that a chunk is repleted
with fish, every Fish Farming
Repletion Min.
FishChunkRepletionMinutes-Comment:
Real life minutes before a chunk is
repleted with fish (by Fish Farming
Repletion Rate percent).
FishEggsChunkRepletionRate-Comment:
Percentage that a chunk is repleted
with fish when you drop ovulated
fish eggs into the water in that
chunk.
FishChunkMaxDepletionPercent-Comment:
The maximum % amount that a chunk
can be depleted of fish.
FurrowedLandUpdateFrequency-Comment:
How often (seconds) furrowed land
waters neighbors and blockages might
form.
FurrowedLandBlockageChancePercent-Commen:
Percentage chance of a blockage
forming (every Furrowed Land Update
Seconds).
FurrowedLandEnabled-Comment:
Allow hoe to create furrowed land.
Disable this if you prefer the
Better Hoe hoe, or you just don't
like furrowed land.
FurrowedLandMinMoistureClose-Comment:
Maximum moisture % of farmland
directly adjacent to a furrow.
FurrowedLandMinMoistureFar-Comment:
Maximum moisture % of farmland
two blocks away from a furrow.
LimbTrotlineCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish on the hook (with no bait or
lure) of a limb line or trotline,
every Limb Line/Trotline Update
Minutes.
LimbTrotlineBaitedCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish on the baited hook of a limb
line or trotline, every Limb
Line/Trotline Update Minutes.
LimbTrotlineLuredCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish on the lured hook of a limb
line or trotline, every Limb
Line/Trotline Update Minutes.
LimbTrotlineBaitedLuredCatchPercent-Comm:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish on the baited+lured hook of a
limb line or trotline, every Limb
Line/Trotline Update Minutes.
LimbTrotlineBaitStolenPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of bait being
stolen from the hook of a limb line
or trotline, every Limb
Line/Trotline Update Minutes.
LimbTrotlineUpdateMinutes-Comment:
Real life minutes until limb lines
and trotlines are potentially
updated.
LimbTrotlineRotRemovedPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that rot on the
hook of a limb line or trotline will
be removed, every Limb Line/Trotline
Update Minutes.
ParticulatorEnabled-Comment:
Enable the Particulator and
associated Link Tool. It is disabled
by default because it has issues in
multiplayer.  Only enable this in
single player.
ParticulatorMaxParticlesQuantity-Comment:
The maximum number of particles you
can set in the gui.
ParticulatorMaxParticlesSize-Comment:
The maximum particle size you can
set in the gui.
ParticulatorHideCodeTabs-Comment:
Whether or not the CODE tab(s) are
visible in the Particulator's gui.
RaftWaterSpeedModifier-Comment:
Multiplier that determines the
speed of a raft. Be careful with
this, it's sensitive.
RaftFlotationModifier-Comment:
How fast the raft accelerates from
under water to the surface
(buoyancy). Be careful with this,
it's sensitive.
ShowModNameInHud-Comment:
Show the name of this mod when
looking at blocks.  In the hud.
ShowModNameInGuis-Comment:
Show the name of this mod in gui
popups when looking at anything from
this mod.
SnareBaitStolenPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that a snare will
have its bait stolen and inflict no
damage.
SnareMaxAnimalHeight-Comment:
Entities with this eye height or
less can be seriously damaged by
this trap (so, pigs or smaller).
SnareMaxDamageSet-Comment:
Maximum damage inflicted by an
unbaited snare.
SnareMaxDamageBaited-Comment:
Maximum damage inflicted by a
baited snare.
SnareTrippedPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that a snare will
be tripped and inflict no damage.
SpawnMultiplierBio-Comment:
Bioluminescent spawn rate will be
multiplied by this to decrease or
increase the default spawn rate.
SpawnMultiplier-Comment:
Spawn rate will be multiplied by
this to decrease or increase
the default spawn rate.
TreeHollowsMaxItems-Comment:
Maximum number of items that can be
found in a tree hollow.
TreeHollowsEnableDeveloperTools-Comment:
Enable to help with adding new
items to tree hollows.
TreeHollowsMaxPerChunk-Comment:
Maximum spawn count of tree hollows
in new chunks.
TreeHollowsSpawnProbability-Comment:
Probability of a tree hollow to
spawn in a new chunk.
TreeHollowsUpdateMinutes-Comment:
How often the contents of a tree
hollow is replenished.
WeirTrapCatchPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance of catching a
fish in a weir trap, every Weir Trap
Update Minutes.
WeirTrapEscapePercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that something in
a weir trap will escape, every Weir
Trap Update Minutes.
WeirTrapUpdateMinutes-Comment:
Real life minutes until weir traps
are potentially updated.
WeirTrapRotRemovedPercent-Comment:
Percentage chance that rot in a
weir trap will be removed, every
Weir Trap Update Minutes.
WormFoundPercentRock-Comment:
Percentage chance of finding a worm
when you right click pick up a
normal rock.
WormFoundPercentStickFlint-Comment:
Percentage chance of finding a worm
when you right click pick up a stick
or flint.
RelicsDisabled-Comment:
Prevent catching relics in weir
traps and fish baskets.
blockdesc-rockblastingbomb: This bomb is particularly effective for mining rock, but less so for ore blasting.
itemdesc-fishingspear-*: Thrust like a regular spear to catch fish.
ingameerror-mb-close-endpoint-invalid: The close endpoint is invalid. It needs to be a full size block with a full size block above it
ingameerror-mb-far-endpoint-invalid: The far endpoint is invalid. It needs to be a full size block with a full size block above it
ingameerror-mb-close-endpoint-neighbor-i: The close endpoint is invalid. There is something next to it blocking the placement
ingameerror-mb-far-endpoint-neighbor-inv: The far endpoint is invalid. There is something next to it blocking the placement
ingameerror-mb-bridge-too-far: It looks like you need more pieces of monkey bridge, or the distance between endpoints exceeds the max length
ingameerror-mb-bridge-cant-place: There is a monkey bridge in the way
game:placefailure-support-ground-unsuita: you need more suitable ground to place this support
blockdesc-support-*: Place supports on fertile ground to hold pipes
blockdesc-pipe-*-aerated: Used with overhead irrigation (pipe supports) to irrigate farmland
blockdesc-pipe-*-plain: Used with overhead irrigation (pipe supports) to transport water
support-rightclick-add-pipe: Right click to add a pipe to this support
pipe-rightclick-add-pipe: Right click on a pipe end to add more pipe
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-re: Better Black clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-br: Better Brown clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-bl: Better Black clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-gr: Better Gray clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-cr: Better Cream clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-or: Better Orange clay large brick stairs
block-betterfoureightbrickstairs-four-ta: Better Tan clay large brick stairs
game:placefailure-softer-ground-needed: you can only place this in soft ground
